meanings.definition: A conical textile tube designed to indicate wind direction and speed.
meanings.sent1: The colorful windsocks at the airport show pilots which way the wind is blowing.
meanings.sent2: I saw the windsocks fluttering in the breeze, pointing towards the east.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the windsocks for a giant toy and tried to climb it.
meanings.sent4: Her flowing dress billowed like a windsock in the strong gusts of wind.
meanings.sent5: The windsocks danced wildly in the storm, a vibrant display of nature's power.

meanings.definition: To use windsocks to determine wind conditions.
meanings.sent1: The meteorologist will windsocks to predict the weather for the hot air balloon race.
meanings.sent2: We windsocks before setting sail to ensure safe navigation on the lake.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to windsocks to see who could blow the hardest.
meanings.sent4: She windsocks carefully before deciding it was too windy to hang laundry outside.
meanings.sent5: The farmer windsocks every morning to plan the best time to plant his crops.
